Narrative: Yesterday was such a hectic day for me as an undergrad at DLSU. In the morning, I had to tackle my mountain of assignments and prepare for an upcoming exam. However, my plans were derailed when my mom asked for my help with some yardwork. Reluctantly, I put on my old clothes and spent hours under the scorching sun, sweating and battling weeds. Exhausted, I finally returned to my books, only to find that the day had gotten away from me. Despite the hassle, I couldn't help but appreciate the satisfaction of a well-maintained garden.

After attending my morning classes, I realized that I had completely forgotten about the yardwork and outside home maintenance that needed to be done. With no time to waste, I quickly changed into some old clothes and grabbed the necessary tools. Sweating under the scorching sun, I trimmed the overgrown grass and bushes, swept away fallen leaves, and even fixed a broken fence. Although it was exhausting, seeing the tidy and well-maintained yard brought a sense of accomplishment. Now, I can finally relax and focus on my studies for the rest of the day.
